definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: He was disconcerted to discover that he had lost the papers.
sentences.chinese: 他发现自己遗失文件而惊慌失措。

sentences.english: PR8 Total number of substantiated complaints regarding breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data.
sentences.chinese: PR8违反客户隐私及遗失客户资料的申诉案总数。

sentences.english: When and where did you last see it?
sentences.chinese: 您是何时何地最后见到遗失物的？

sentences.english: It gives me the peacefulness and simplicity that the city exhausts too easily.
sentences.chinese: 它让我找到了容易在城市遗失的平静跟简朴。

sentences.english: Infm the Front Office Manger Manger on Duty Security immediately of lost items.
sentences.chinese: 遗失物品通知前厅经理或值班经理和保安部。

sentences.english: No, I guess Rosebud is just a… piece in a jigsaw puzzle… a missing piece.
sentences.chinese: 我猜，玫瑰花蕾也许就是拼图上的一块，遗失的一块。

sentences.english: I've lost my bankcard. Can you stop an transactions?
sentences.chinese: 我遗失了我的银行卡，你能帮我冻结账户吗？

sentences.english: But crucial facts have been lost in this simplistic red-hazed debate.
sentences.chinese: 但关键事实已在这场过分简单化的红肉辩论中遗失了。

sentences.english: Any loss or destroy of the membership card, $50 compensative procedures fee shall be given.
sentences.chinese: 会员卡如有遗失或损毁，补领手续为每张港币50元。

sentences.english: It beats me how she found her lost ring .
sentences.chinese: 我难以理解她怎么能找到她那遗失的戒指。

sentences.english: This engine has lost its power.
sentences.chinese: 这台发念头已遗失了动力。

sentences.english: The words I love you, lost in the unease.
sentences.chinese: 那句我爱你，遗失在流年里。

sentences.english: Ignorant people believe his ravings and lose their original resolve.
sentences.chinese: 彼无知者，信是虚诳，遗失本心。

sentences.english: All the cargo derrick wires and mooring ropes were also missing.
sentences.chinese: 所有吊机用的钢绳以及靠泊用的缆绳亦均遗失。

sentences.english: If you lose your wallet in the subway, you expect to get it back.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在地铁遗失了钱包，你很可能还会找到。

definition: to leave behind (inadvertently)/to forget/to omit/to leave out
to return something to its rightful owner
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
to deposit/to store/to leave sth with sb
owner of sth lost or stolen
